Here’s what you missed if you haven’t been to Vietnam yet Published on : Tuesday, September 8, 2015
Backpacker’s paradise starts at Vietnam. With places like Vang Vieng which is just a few hours away where you can lumber down a river enjoying sip of mushroom shakes, it’s possibly going to be one of the most fascinating trips if you have ever thought. Sort out stay, food, drink and transport and Vietnam will leave you with all happy memories. Solo traveling might just add to more to the fun!
Food
Yes! No matter in which part of the world you are, if the food is good, everything will fall into place. And Vietnamese street foods will not upset you. In fact, the best place to eat in Vietnam is on little, plastic stools on the sidewalk. be it the noodle soups with the iconic pho or bun ca (the fish and pork-based soup), or the bun cha – char-grilled pork served over rice noodles with herbs and dipping sauces, Vietnamese people will always love to welcome you with their warm-hearted smile.
History
Tumultuous and complex are possibly the best words to explain Vietnam’s history. Colonial influences are evident as you walk the city roads. The aftermath of the Vietnam War is apparent too — in the museums and monuments but also in the faces and stories of survivors and the overwhelmingly young population. Those who appreciate and believe that history will always remain interwoven in the present scenarios; it will be captivating for them. And isn’t it always great to know about the tales which left a mark on the world history?
Architecture and culture
There are a large number of well-preserved temples which stands to tell the tales of culture spanning hundreds of years. The Temple of Literature in Hanoi is devoted to Confucius and scholars in general. Built in 1070, it hosts Vietnam’s first national university. You will also find large number of stelae which are raised to commemorate the achievements of great scholars throughout the years
Mekong Delta
The area near the Southwestern Vietnam the Mekong River dumps into the sea which creates a spectacular view. No matter how many times you have already been to the place, traveling up the backwaters will always be a charming experience.
Beaches
One of the most unsung beauties of the country, Vietnam’s beaches might for a moment make the visitors confuse them as one of that of Thailand or Cambodia. Nha Trang and Mui Ne are the ones which see the footfall of quite a number of tourist-traffic but beaches like Doc Let are no less charming. Con Dao and Phu Quoc are some of the most gorgeous islands in South East Asia.
Caves
Son Doong Cave, the biggest cave in the world is at Vietnam. Mammoth caves which actually hold the entire jungles as well as the lakes are found and still leave the scope of discovery.
Affordability
Vietnam is a well-known destination among budget travelers. No matter how much the price daunts these days, it is still cheaper than visiting most of the other continents.
Dramatic landscapes, fascinating history, epic food, and pulsating energy, Vietnam is all set to make your senses go mesmerized from all angles.
